text: Lawton Wehle Fitt (born July 1953) is an American banker. She completed college at Brown University, majoring in European history. After working in Burkina Faso with the Peace Corps, she studied at the University of Virginia's Darden School of Business. From 1979 to 2002, Fitt was a banker with Goldman Sachs. In 2002, Fitt succeeded David Gordon as secretary of the Royal Academy, holding that position until 2005. ==References== Category:1953 births Category:American bankers Category:Living people Category:Brown University alumni Category:University of Virginia alumni Category:Goldman Sachs people Category:Peace Corps volunteers
title: Lawton Fitt
